00015 /// \file
00016 /// Provides the global variables instructions.
00017 
00018 #include <machine.hpp>
00019 #include <instructions.hpp>
00020 
00021 namespace Instructions {
00022     
00023 #if MIT_COMPATIBILITY != MIT_ONLY
00024     /// \name Threads
00025     /// \{
00026     
00027     /// Activate this or another Thread.
00028     /**
00029      * \see Thread::activate()
00030      * 
00031      * \param Int The index of the Thread to activate.
00032      */
00033     void ACTIVATE(Machine & machine){
00034         Thread::Id thread = machine.nextInt();
00035         machine.threads[thread].activate();
00036     }
00037     
00038     /// Deactivate this or another Thread.
00039     /**
00040      * \see Thread::deactivate()
00041      * 
00042      * \param Int The index of the Thread to deactivate.
00043      */
00044     void DEACTIVATE(Machine & machine){
00045         Thread::Id thread = machine.nextInt();
00046         machine.threads[thread].deactivate();
00047     }
00048     
00049     /// Trigger this or another Thread.
00050     /**
00051      * \see Thread::trigger()
00052      * 
00053      * \param Int The index of the Thread to trigger.
00054      */
00055     void TRIGGER(Machine & machine){
00056         Thread::Id thread = machine.nextInt();
00057         machine.threads[thread].trigger();
00058     }
00059     
00060     /// Get the result of the last execution of this or another Thread.
00061     /**
00062      * \param Int The index of the Thread.
00063      * \return Data The result of the last execution of the specified Thread.
00064      */
00065     void RESULT(Machine & machine){
00066         Thread::Id thread = machine.nextInt();
00067         machine.stack.push(machine.threads[thread].result);
00068     }
00069     
00070     /// \}
00071 #endif
00072     
00073 }
